summary: Adds four new standalone colour combinations for the Witcher 3 Yennefer Default Outfit to Skyrim, for Vanilla/UNP female only bodies.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000]
[color=#ffff00][size=4][size=5]3/13/16: Future Update[size=4]-[/size][/size]
I just realized the first person textures are set wrong.... because I finally got into my game, low and behold, wrong colours popped up. So that will be corrected within the next two weeks should I have a spare moment. Also, additional earth tone colours will be added. Most likely a brown or creme, perhaps a lighter less saturated blue, and one other colour to be determined still. I'd like to think I would be adding a different fur colour option, but depends on how I am feeling once I get into it. Plus, I am working on several mods at the moment I want to get out first.
________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/size][/color]
Long story short: These were promised to be released some time ago, before the Ciri DLC outfit. Just now getting to them. Four bright colours to start with. I will not guarantee others, but if more follow they will be more toned down. I have yet to touch the Yennefer DLC outfit. Those will be earthtones once I get started.[/color]


This is for 4 sets in bright colours for the Witcher 3 Yennefer Default, Originally imported for Skyrim by zzjay.

These are standalone for UNP/Vanilla bodies. No weight slider support, which is how the original meshes were created.
I will not create weight sliders or body slides.


Craftable under leather, or use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64905]AddItemMenu[/url] Mod and item search under Vengerberg.

Items are listed in crafting/inventory menus as Vengerberg. There are a few Yennefer outfit mods now for Skyrim. This is to avoid any confusion between the other mods and bypass any similar files names which could cause issues.

They are listed as such:

Vengerberg Black Fur
Vengerberg Brown Fur
Vengerberg Grey Fur
(these require leather and wolf pelts)


Vengerberg Blue Outfit, Gloves, Boots
Vengerberg Blue Stripes Outfit, Gloves, Boots
Vengerberg Grey Outfit, Gloves, Boots
Vengerberg Red Outfit, Gloves, Boots
(these items require only leather)

Vengerberg Pendant
(requires leather and iron ingot)

Craft under leather, upgradeable and enchantable.



[center][color=#3c78d8][size=4]Installation:[/size][/color]
Install via NMM or MO.
Or if you prefer to manually install, then by all means...


[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Requirements:[/size][/color]
None. But if you find the shoes hovering over the ground, or sinking below it,
you may want to use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36213]HDT HighHeels System[/url] to correct the offset.
That's not a guarantee that anyone will have this issue. Just a note of precaution in the event it happens.
HDT Heels fixes all![/center]
[center][color=#3c78d8][size=4]Credits:[/size][/color]
CD Projekt Red for their original meshes/textures/concepts. All original meshes/textures are intellectual
property of CD Projekt Red.
Zzjay for the original import from Witcher to Skyrim


[color=#3c78d8][size=4]Permissions:[/size][/color]
If you want different sizes on the original textures from zzjay, you must contact her. I will not authorize these textures
for body types other than UNP base/Vanilla/CBBE base.

This may not be uploade to other sites. It stays with Nexus only!

Contact zzjay if you wish to use assets from the Yennefer outfit in your own mods.[/center]
author: ViciousSARR
